message: As far as I know, Mostly Photo will be on Tuesdays 1:00pm Pacific
@spaceguy1 Thanks pal!
It is up now: http://twit.tv/photo
@jomobono Brilliant! Cheers for the link.
Is it a podcast cause I'm a photographer might like to check it out
It is a podcast for beginners.
Video or just Audio
It launched on the 24th . Get it @ http://twit.tv/photo
I would not say it is strictly for beginners. They're are having some cool guest.
I would say photo hobbyists as opposed to Pro's.
I was hoping this show would be geared more towards beginners...
@Jude It will partially for beginners. I guess they will show us how to make our photos better.

It may be aimed for mostly beginners, but at least the chat room seemed to be occupied by w@nkers who apparently have never encountered, let alone handled a hottie in real life.

Other than that, I think the show is getting better w/ more mileage. Show #2 was a bit better than show#1. 

Speaking of the theme of the show, does anyone know or remember how much difference there is between the camera in an iPhone 3Gs and iPhone 4? That is, as long as still photos are concerned, not video.
@lessfeet That would be great!
I believe its already on iTunes
@iurus The iPhone 4 is a lot better especially in low light. Well worth the upgrade IMO.
@iurus Yeah but hottie or not, they are probably not going to waste an hour on that unless they are interested in photography?
I know the iPhone 1 had a 2MP camera. The ip4 has a 5MP camera with focus. Fantastic camera.
Here's a photo I took in low light today with the iPhone 4 and edited with camera+ then uploaded direct to flickr! http://www.flickr.com/photos/areaguides/5574752705/

@rcs Yeap, I was afraid to get a reply like that. It's not about the megapixels alone, but other details as well. 
Then again, with all the rumours about iPhone 5 coming pretty soon, perhaps I'll still wait.  I'm also interested to see what the new HP/Palm line will be like, as a whole.
Very cool photo of a nearly 100-yo old Harley.

Actually, I used to hate all the phone cameras or camera phones earlier, but at least now iPhone and some other Android phones have pretty cool photo apps that make them much more interesting and useful.

@HateBadDesign Well, based on the comments over there, I wouldn't be too sure about it. ;) 
BTW, I was just being sarcastic, you now. Commenting what I saw in a less than serious manner.

Related to the show #2, Here's Robert Scoble's interview w/ the quest of the show: http://scobleizer.com/2011/03/30/trey-ratcliff-releases-one-of-the-sexiest-photo-editing-apps-for-ipad/
